meta.title: Barrana AI Content Agent - Complete Production-Ready Prompt Library
meta.description: Merged prompt library combining enterprise validation with comprehensive content templates

secondary_keywords: AI missed revenue opportunities / find missed sales business

refresh_policy.description: Update keyword list via SEO analysis twice a week

globals.tone: Professional but approachable; plain-English for SMB decision makers with technical precision for developers
globals.cta: Contact us via www.barrana.ai or book a consultation.

dos: Include KPI checklists for business content
donts: Do not post identical content across platforms; adapt for each
Do not share client-specific data without explicit approval
No links in LinkedIn quick posts

validators.message_on_fail: CTA missing (required for all platforms except StackOverflow)
Keyword density exceeds 3% - reduce keyword usage
FAQ section required for content 1000+ words
Content appears duplicated across platforms - ensure adaptation
Voice does not match platform requirements (I vs We)

linkedin.prompt_template:
Write a {word_count_min}-{word_count_max} word LinkedIn post from the perspective of 'I (Ikram Rana)' about: {description}.

Structure:
1. Start with a bold contrarian statement about the pain point
2. Provide insight/evidence (2-3 sentences) - reference WSJ/NFX/Reddit if relevant
3. Present the solution approach
4. End with engaging question to audience

Style: Thought leadership, professional but approachable, use line breaks and bullet points for readability

Keywords to include naturally: {primary_keywords} (1 keyword), {secondary_keywords} (1 keyword)

Hashtags: Include 3-5 relevant hashtags: #AIForBusiness, #AutomationForSMBs, #Barrana, #WorkflowAutomation, #SmallBusiness

End with CTA: {cta}

Tone: First-person, punchy, opinion-led. Use plain English for SMB decision makers.

linkedin_quick.prompt_template:
Create a short LinkedIn post (80-150 words) from 'I (Ikram Rana)' perspective about: {description}.

Structure:
1. Opening line: bold contrarian take
2. 2-3 sentences or bullets showing evidence
3. End with open-ended question

Style: Punchy, opinion-led, use line breaks and bullets
Keywords: Include 1 primary keyword naturally: {primary_keywords}
Hashtags: 2-3 maximum
No links - keep native and light
End with: {cta}

medium.note: Adapt from Substack but do not copy text verbatim
medium.prompt_template:
Write a comprehensive Medium article (900-1200 words) from 'We (Barrana)' perspective about: {description}.

Structure:

2. Hook opening paragraph
3. Problem identification (SMB pain point)
4. Evidence section (reference WSJ/NFX/Reddit insights)
5. Solution presentation with actionable steps
6. Conclusion with clear next steps

SEO Requirements:
- Include 2 primary keywords: {primary_keywords}
- Include 1 secondary keyword: {secondary_keywords}
- Use keywords in title, intro, and at least 1 subheading
- Create 3-4 H2 subheadings with keywords

Style: Professional but approachable, blend plain English for SMB decision makers
Note: Adapt from Substack content but don't copy exact text
Visuals: [Cover Image Placeholder] and [Diagram Placeholder]
End with: {cta}
Tags to suggest: 5-7 relevant tags for Medium

substack.structure: Narrative intro → Problem → Evidence (WSJ/NFX/Reddit) → Roadmap (30/60/90) → CTA
substack.prompt_template:
Create a Substack newsletter (1000-1500 words) from 'We (Barrana)' perspective about: {description}.

Structure:
1. Narrative introduction with hook
2. Problem identification for SMBs
3. Evidence section with references to WSJ/NFX/Reddit insights
4. 30/60/90 day roadmap for implementation:
   - 30 days: Initial assessment and quick wins
   - 60 days: Core implementation
   - 90 days: Optimization and scaling
5. Clear CTA

Keywords to include naturally:
- Primary (2): {primary_keywords}
- Secondary (2): {secondary_keywords}

Visuals: [Infographic Placeholder] and [Flowchart Placeholder]

End with: {cta}

substack_quick.prompt_template:
Write a Substack quick note (200-300 words) from 'We (Barrana)' perspective about: {description}.

Structure:
1. 1-2 sentence hook (bold statement or question)
2. Short anecdote or market observation (Reddit/WSJ/NFX reference optional)
3. 1 key insight or challenge to reader
4. Soft CTA

Style: Personal, sharp, opinionated; leave room to expand later
Keyword: Include 1 primary keyword: {primary_keywords}
Tone: Provocative, ask 'what if?' or 'why not?'
Don't overload with evidence (save for long-form)
End with soft CTA linking to barrana.ai

barrana_blog.structure: H1 title, multiple H2/H3 with keywords, FAQ section, KPI checklist
barrana_blog.prompt_template:
Create a comprehensive blog post (1500-2000 words) for Barrana.ai from 'We (Barrana)' perspective about: {description}.

Structure:
1. SEO-optimized H1 title with primary keyword
2. Executive summary (150 words)
3. Problem definition (H2 with keyword)
4. Evidence and market analysis (H2 with keyword)
5. Solution framework (H2 with keyword)
6. Implementation roadmap (H2 with keyword)
7. KPI tracking checklist:
   - Cost reduction metrics
   - Time savings measurements
   - Revenue impact tracking
   - Process efficiency indicators
8. FAQ section (5-7 questions):
   - What ROI can SMBs expect?
   - How long does implementation take?
   - What are common challenges?
   - Which processes should be automated first?
   - How to measure success?
9. Conclusion with CTA

SEO Requirements:
- Primary keywords (2-3): {primary_keywords}
- Secondary keywords (2): {secondary_keywords}
- Keywords in title, intro, and subheadings
- Internal linking opportunities

Visuals to include:
- [Comparison Table Placeholder]
- [Process Flowchart Placeholder]
- [KPI Checklist Placeholder]

Style: Technical precision for developers, plain English for SMB decision makers
End with: {cta}

twitter.prompt_template:
Create a Twitter thread (8-12 tweets) about: {description}.

Thread Structure:
1. Hook tweet with bold statement (280 chars max)
2-3. Problem identification tweets (280 chars each)
4-6. Insights and evidence tweets (280 chars each)
7-9. Solution/roadmap tweets (280 chars each)
10-11. Examples or case studies (280 chars each)
12. CTA tweet (280 chars max)

Keyword: Include 1 primary keyword across thread: {primary_keywords}
Hashtags: 2-3 max (#AIForBusiness, #AutomationForSMBs, #Barrana)
Style: Hook → Insights → Evidence → SMB roadmap → CTA
Tone: Plain English, punchy, easy to retweet
End thread with: {cta}
